result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel D Schumacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of Probation shall remain the same as conditions of Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel D Schumacher

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Michael M. Hayes.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached and Defense free to argue as to condition time.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Obstruct an Officer pursuant to sec. 946.41(1) and plea to Ct. 2 as charged.  Argument by counsel.  Court will not approve amendment.  Defendant will enter a plea to Ct. 1 as charged.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
